intro: Ophelia trilobata, commonly known as narrowleaf water-plantain, is a herbaceous wetland plant native to North America. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in ponds, streams, and marshes. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often submerged or floating, with a distinctive three-lobed structure. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in early summer. Ophelia trilobata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
